thread.title: Auburn freshman guard Bryce Brown sits out scrimmage
thread.title_full: Auburn freshman guard Bryce Brown sits out scrimmage

author: James Crepea | jcrepea@al.com
title: Auburn freshman guard Bryce Brown sits out scrimmage
text:
Auburn freshman guard Bryce Brown sits out scrimmage Bryce Brown.JPG Comments 
Auburn freshman guard Bryce Brown sat out Saturday's practice due to a minor ankle injury suffered earlier in the week. 
Brown, one of four freshmen, was stretched and rode an exercise bike on the sideline and did some limited individual shooting. 
"New Williams landed on his ankle on Wednesday," Auburn coach Bruce Pearl said. "Probably, if this was a game, he could have played today." 
Known for his shooting ability - Pearl said Brown could "shoot it from anywhere" in the gym" - Brown averaged 25 points, six rebounds and four assists as a senior at High School.
